Department of Pharmacology and Physiology, University of Rochester Medical Center, Rochester, New York 14642 brenowitzs@janelia.hhmi.org ian.duguid@ed.ac.uk paul_kammermeier@urmc.rochester.edu.
text: From patch-clamp techniques to recombinant DNA technologies, three-dimensional protein modeling, and optogenetics, diverse and sophisticated methods have been used to study ion channels and how they determine the electrical properties of cells.
title: Ion Channels: History, Diversity, and Impact.
